00001 /*********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         bt617.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Cotents:      Routines for accessing VME over SBS Bit3 Model 617
00007                 Interface under Windows NT using the NT device driver 
00008                 Model 983 and under Linux using the vmehb device
00009                 driver.
00010 
00011   $LOG$
00012 *********************************************************************/
00013 
00014 #include    <stdio.h>
00015 
00016 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00017 #define BT_NTDRIVER
00018 #define BT_WINNT
00019 #define BT973
00020 #include    "btapi.h"
00021 #endif
00022 
00023 #include    "mvmestd.h"
00024 
00025 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00026 
00027 int vme_open(int device, int mode)
00028 {
00029    bt_error_t status;           /* Bit 3 library error return type */
00030    char devname[BT_MAX_DEV_NAME];       /* Device to open */
00031    bt_devdata_t flag;
00032    bt_desc_t btd;
00033 
00034    /* derive device name */
00035    switch (mode) {
00036    case VME_A16D16:
00037    case VME_A16D32:
00038       bt_gen_name(device, BT_DEV_A16, devname, BT_MAX_DEV_NAME);
00039       break;
00040    case VME_A24D16:
00041    case VME_A24D32:
00042       bt_gen_name(device, BT_DEV_A24, devname, BT_MAX_DEV_NAME);
00043       break;
00044    case VME_A32D16:
00045    case VME_A32D32:
00046       bt_gen_name(device, BT_DEV_A32, devname, BT_MAX_DEV_NAME);
00047       break;
00048 
00049    case VME_LM:
00050       bt_gen_name(device, BT_DEV_LM, devname, BT_MAX_DEV_NAME);
00051       break;
00052 
00053    default:
00054       printf("Unknown VME mode %d\n", mode);
00055       return -1;
00056    }
00057 
00058    /* open device */
00059    status = bt_open(&btd, devname, BT_RDWR);
00060    if (status != BT_SUCCESS) {
00061       bt_perror(btd, status, "vme_open error");
00062       return -1;
00063    }
00064    bt_init(btd);
00065    bt_clrerr(btd);
00066 
00067    /* select swapping mode */
00068    if (mode != VME_LM) {
00069       flag = BT_SWAP_NONE;
00070       bt_set_info(btd, BT_INFO_SWAP, flag);
00071 
00072       /* set data mode */
00073       flag = (mode == VME_A16D16 || mode == VME_A24D16 || mode == VME_A32D16) ?
00074         BT_WIDTH_D16 : BT_WIDTH_D32;
00075       bt_set_info(btd, BT_INFO_DATAWIDTH, flag);
00076 
00077       /* switch on block transfer */
00078       flag = TRUE;
00079       bt_set_info(btd, BT_INFO_BLOCK, flag);
00080 
00081       flag = 256;
00082       bt_set_info(btd, BT_INFO_DMA_POLL_CEILING, flag);
00083 
00084       flag = 256;
00085       bt_set_info(btd, BT_INFO_DMA_THRESHOLD, flag);
00086    }
00087 
00088    return (int) btd;
00089 }
00090 
00091 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00092 
00093 int vme_close(int btd)
00094 {
00095    bt_error_t status;
00096 
00097    status = bt_close((bt_desc_t) btd);
00098    if (status != BT_SUCCESS)
00099       bt_perror((bt_desc_t) btd, status, "vme_close error");
00100 
00101    return (int) status;
00102 }

00104 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00105 
00106 static int last_dma = -1;
00107 
00108 int vme_read(int vh, void *dst, int vme_addr, int size, int dma)
00109 {
00110    bt_error_t status;
00111    int read, flag;
00112 
00113    if (dma != last_dma) {
00114       last_dma = dma;
00115 
00116       flag = dma ? 256 : 100000000;
00117 
00118       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_DMA_POLL_CEILING, flag);
00119       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_DMA_THRESHOLD, flag);
00120    }
00121 
00122    status = bt_read((bt_desc_t) vh, dst, vme_addr, size, &read);
00123    if (status != BT_SUCCESS)
00124       bt_perror((bt_desc_t) vh, status, "vme_read error");
00125 
00126    return read;
00127 }
00128 
00129 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00130 
00131 int vme_write(int vh, void *src, int vme_addr, int size, int dma)
00132 {
00133    bt_error_t status;
00134    int read, flag;
00135 
00136    if (dma != last_dma) {
00137       last_dma = dma;
00138 
00139       flag = dma ? 256 : 100000000;
00140 
00141       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_DMA_POLL_CEILING, flag);
00142       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_DMA_THRESHOLD, flag);
00143    }
00144 
00145    status = bt_write((bt_desc_t) vh, src, vme_addr, size, &read);
00146    if (status != BT_SUCCESS)
00147       bt_perror((bt_desc_t) vh, status, "vme_write error");
00148 
00149    return read;
00150 }

00153 
00154 int vme_mmap(int vh, void **ptr, int vme_addr, int size)
00155 {
00156    bt_error_t status;
00157 
00158    status = bt_mmap((bt_desc_t) vh, ptr, vme_addr, size, BT_RDWR, BT_SWAP_DEFAULT);
00159    if (status != BT_SUCCESS)
00160       bt_perror((bt_desc_t) vh, status, "vme_mmap error");
00161 
00162    return status == BT_SUCCESS ? 1 : (int) status;
00163 }
00164 
00165 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00166 
00167 int vme_unmap(int vh, void *ptr, int size)
00168 {
00169    bt_error_t status;
00170 
00171    status = bt_unmmap((bt_desc_t) vh, ptr, size);
00172    if (status != BT_SUCCESS)
00173       bt_perror((bt_desc_t) vh, status, "vme_unmap error");
00174 
00175    return status == BT_SUCCESS ? 1 : (int) status;
00176 }

00179 
00180 int vme_ioctl(int vh, int request, int *param)
00181 {
00182    switch (request) {
00183    case VME_IOCTL_AMOD_SET:
00184       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_DMA_AMOD, *param);
00185       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_PIO_AMOD, *param);
00186       bt_set_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_MMAP_AMOD, *param);
00187       break;
00188    case VME_IOCTL_AMOD_GET:
00189       bt_get_info((bt_desc_t) vh, BT_INFO_DMA_AMOD, param);
00190       break;
00191    }
00192    return SUCCESS;
00193 }
